A Year on 16 Psyche

YEAR ON PSYCHE

You are part of a team of scientists tasked with exploring the asteroid 16 Psyche. Your team is to spend one Psyche Year discovering the asteroid's temperature, seasons, and surface. Below contains some helpful information to understand some key differences between 16 Psyche and your home planet Earth:

A Psyche Year

One year on Psyche is approximately 5 years on Earth.

One day on Psyche is just over 4 hours long (one rotation on its axis).

Temperatures on Psyche

You will need to dress warm, as Psyche's temperature ranges from X to X

Be careful exploring as the dark side of Psyche is the coldest with temperatures believed to get as low as -X

Psyche's surface

Click Here to learn more about Psyche's surface

Reason for the mission

Scientists think Psyche may consist of significant amounts of metal from the core of a planetesimal, one of the building blocks of our solar system.

The asteroid is most likely a survivor of multiple violent hit-and-run collisions, common when the solar system was forming

Psyche may be able to tell us how Earth's core and the cores of the other rocky, or terrestrial, planets came to be.

Psyche's location

Click Here to learn more about where Psyche is located in our Solar System

Psyche's name

Psyche was discovered by Italian astronomer Annibale de Gasparis on March 17, 1852.

Psyche, the Greek goddess of the soul who was born mortal and married Eros (Roman Cupid), the god of Love.

Because it was the 16th asteroid to be discovered, it is sometimes referred to as 16 Psyche.
